Hi Everyone, thanks for clicking, I am Niharika.
In today's lesson we are gonna look at some

expressions with the word cry. You shed tears
in pain and sorrow, but in English we do have

expressions that you can use in your daily
conversations using the word cry. SO they

are not only related to crying and whining
but you can use it in your daily conversation
as well, so let's get started.

There are six expressions here and let's look
at the very first one.

A cry baby now who is a cry baby? Well someone
who cries for anything and everything. SO

someone who cries on all silly matters, always
whining, always complaining, that person is

cry baby. Especially kids, have you ever noticed,
kids are always whining. If he is not a happy

child, he is always whining and complaining
so he is such a cry baby. But then its not

just kids, I know adults who are always complaining
and crying about everything, about every situation.

So they are cry babies. SO use this expression
for someone who is always crying and whining

about silly things . SO they are cry babies,
if you have a friend then you can say"Oh you

are such a cry baby,look at you are always
whining and complaining ". SO that's how you
can use this expression.

Now the second expression that I have for
you with the word cry is cry over spilled

milk. You in life at times we are very unhappy
and worrying about things that just happened

but there's no point because you really cannot
rectify or undo these things. Right! so .....

SO for example you bumped your car into a
tree.Okay you bumped your car into a tree

and there's nothing you can do about it. SO
there's no point in worrying and crying over

this because you really cannot go back in
time and change the situation. SO what's the

point crying over the spilled milk. SO some
situation you are worrying about and you are

extremely unhappy about it, that cannot be
undone or rectified then you are crying over

spilled milk. SO that's how you would use
this expression.

Let's have a look at the third expression
here. Cry me a river.

Now when do you use this? Now, this expression
is used in a very sarcastic way. There are

people that you meet in life who are always
complaining about something and you really

don't care,you are very unsympathetic towards
these people, then you sarcastically comment

cry me a river. For example, your colleague.
He is complaining that he's not got a raise,

he's hard working, he's telling you - look
at me Niharika I am so hard working and I

am so diligent about my work but I haven't
got a raise. So if I have to be sarcastic

and I really don't care then I would say "Cry
me a river, I have been working for this company

for five years now and I haven't got a raise".
So I am being sarcastic, I really don't care

what you are going through, look at my situation.
So,that's how I would use this expression.

Now let's have look at the fourth one - Cry
in one's beer - now this expression is used

for self pity. Now the people, especially
your friends probably they go through a break

up or they are not getting a job, they are
complaining and they are constantly calling

you and telling you that Oh look at my life
it's just miserable, I don't see anything

happening, so you know they are self pitying
themselves. So they are crying in their own

beer or they are crying in one's beer. So
it means that they are self pitying themselves.

So the people who keep calling you or when
they meet you they are just complaining about

their life, so it means they are crying in
their own beer. If I have a friend who keeps

complaining about her life to me so I am gonna
say " uh she's always crying in her own beer"

she need to do something about her life now,
right! She's always self pitying herself.

The next one - Cry wolf
Now cry wolf is false alarm .Hey do you remember

the story, the young boy who cried wolf, well
the story was about a shepherd , a young boy

who was a shepherd who use to give this false
alarms to the villagers that " Ohh my God,

there's a wolf, help save us " and the villagers
use to come running with their sticks and

everything that they could to help that shepherd.
But the villagers use to realize that the

boy is just playing a prank and when really
the wolf came, the villagers thought that

its just a false alarm and lets not go save
this boy and the wolf ended up attacking the

sheep and the boy. Right!, remember that story,
as a child I am sure you all have heard about

the story. So this phrase comes from that
story cry wolf, well it is used now as an

expression English when someone is trying
to get some help when they really don't need

it, so it's like a false alarm. Like my cousin
she always screaming in the house that there's

a mouse in the house, but I know it's just
a false alarm so I am gonna say- oh she's

just crying wolf. Okay, so that's how I would
use this expression. Someone who is always

lying or asking for help when it's not really
needed then you can say - oh she's just crying
wolf. So that's how you use this expression.

And then the last one that I have for you
is - Crying shame. Crying shame is a very

unfortunate situation. When things are just
not going right then it's a crying shame.

You know, its very unfortunate. Like my cousin,
she filed for divorce, she lost her job, she

doesn't have much money so its just that things
are not great in her life. So it's a crying

shame - it means that she's just facing a
very unfortunate situation in her life right

now. Another example for you, may be your
colleague is facing a very bad time , his

wife is not well and you know he's not doing
great in his career , so its a crying shame,

its a very unfortunate situation that your
colleague is going through. So that's how

you would use this expression.
Okay so it's not just about crying, whining

and complaining but yes use these expressions
rather than just saying I am crying, she's

crying or he's crying Go ahead and use these
to sound very fluent and confident in English

And I will back with a new lesson soon, till
then you take care.
